reviews.review_msg: I cannot recommend professor Windel enough! He is passionate and whiling to learn and engage with students. Readings matter!
I felt that this prof seemed disengaged with the class during lectures and did not grade fairly. Was very boring during lectures. There are better quality profs than this one. Would never take again.

Took his class in Summer where it was just 1 month. Honestly, had a blast. HIST111 is about tech. He does a good job covering it and getting you thinking about tech & how it evolved in history. Made the dumbest mistakes in my final essay & he still gave me an A- Remember the names of the readings for final. You Nerd? Take it. Not nerd? Not for you

Dr Windel rewards you for your hard worksomething thats rare these days. He is also passionate and skilled lecturer, who will change the way you look at the world. I recommend this class for anyone from history majors to FASS students (me) to science students and beyond!
This course was the hardest course I have ever taken at SFU and I am a 4th year student. It felt like 5 credit class when it was only a 1st year 3 credit course. Not recommended unless necessary.

Film guides which required 2+ hours each and they're only worth 2% each. Three books and weekly readings on garbage PDF's which are required for tutorials. Lectures and slides are unorganized and often went overtime. Don't take this class as an elective as they have the same amount of writing as an English course does.

As a first year student this class was very hard for me. Professor winded was knowledgeable and interested in the content but was very hard on his students. students would get easily bored, but allowed opportunities for extra credit. what I hated the most was not getting a break. we would get one every week but he made us do stuff during that break

A lot of work for this class. Dr. Windel is clearly interested in the content but it unaware that students don't just have this class to work for. The film guides took over 5 hours to complete. this class was just so boring and annoying. Dr. Windel really needs to change the format of his class and make it more enjoyable for his students.

Professor Windel is passionate but his class is very difficult for a first year course. He has too many assignments including weekly questions, films guides and two papers. The reading are really heavy. He believes that students are only taking his class and nothing else. He has really high expectations and is not willing to listen to criticisms.

Aaron is a passionate individual, but this class was one of the worst I have taken at SFU. This is expected to be a first year course, but felt like a third year course. There is so much work involved in this class. There are 5 film guides, weekly questions, 2 papers, a presentation, and a take home final. Final is hard as it requires a lot of work

Dr Windel is clearly passionate about his topics, and that comes across in his lectures. However, he expects his students to share that passion, and assigns a lot of readings (including 2 books and 5 film guides). Watch out for reading quizzes, extra-credit opportunities in-class, and for the marks on your questions and tutorial participation.

Dr. Windel's lectures are decent enough, but the amount of work he assigned was absolutely insane, considering it's a 100-level course and the vast majority of students were just taking it for a b-sci. There are 2 papers, a tutorial presentation, 5 films to watch, 4 novels to read, additional readings, and a take-home final. Would not recommend.
